IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDesc: CHURCHILL SCHOOL PROVIDES ITS students WITH A COMPREHENSIVE EDUCATION THAT DELIVERS THE MOST effective AND INNOVATIVE PROGRAM IN THE FIELD OF LEARNING DISABILITIES.
IRS990.MissionDesc: THE CHURCHILL SCHOOL AND CENTER, A K-12 COEDUCATIONAL COLLEGE PREPARATORY DAY SCHOOL, IS DEDICATED TO WORKING COLLABORATIVELY WITH STUDENTS, EDUCATORS, AND FAMILIES TO HELP CHILDREN WITH LANGUAGE-BASED LEARNING DISABILITIES REALIZE THEIR FULL POTENTIAL. BY BUILDING UPON THEIR STRENGTHS, WE PROVIDE A RIGOROUS PROGRAM THAT TEACHES CHILDREN PERSEVERANCE, RESILIENCE, AND THE IMPORTANCE OF SELF-AWARENESS AND SELF-ADVOCACY. WE PREPARE OUR CHILDREN TO BECOME COURAGEOUS, CONFIDENT, PRODUCTIVE, AND CARING PEOPLE WHO WILL EMBRACE THE CHALLENGES AND OPPORTUNITIES OF THE 21ST CENTURY. TOLERANCE, RESPECT, AND ACTIVE ENGAGEMENT ARE HALLMARKS OF OUR INTENTIONALLY DIVERSE COMMUNITY. THE CHURCHILL SCHOOL AND CENTER RECOGNIZES ITS RESPONSIBILITY TO THE WIDER EDUCATIONAL COMMUNITY AND IS COMMITTED TO REMAINING A LEADER IN ITS FIELD.
IRS990.Desc: CHURCHILL SCHOOL- ELEMENTARY SCHOOL PROVIDES A SUPPORTIVE, STRUCTURED ENVIRONMENT IN WHICH STUDENTS ARE ENCOURAGED TO EXPAND THEIR KNOWLEDGE AND USE THEIR STRENGTHS WHILE DEVELOPING THEIR READING, WRITING, MATH, SOCIAL AND ORGANIZATIONAL SKILLS. STUDENTS LEARN TO ACCEPT AND UNDERSTAND THEIR LEARNING DISABILITIES, BECOME SELF-ADVOCATES AND TAKE RESPONSIBILITY FOR THEIR OWN LEARNING. THE CHURCHILL MIDDLE SCHOOL PROVIDES A SAFE, SUPPORTIVE, AND structured environment in which students are encourages to expand THEIR ACADEMIC KNOWLEDGE WHILE DEVELOPING THEIR ORGANIZATIONAL AND STUDY SKILLS IN PREPARATION FOR HIGH SCHOOL. IN THIS SETTING, DESIGNED FOR THE NEEDS OF THE EARLY ADOLESCENT, STUDENTS FEEL COMFORTABLE EXPLORING THEIR PERSONAL IDENTITIES AND BECOME INCREASINGLY INDEPENDENT. THE CHURCHILL HIGH SCHOOL OFFERS ITS STUDENTS A RICH AND VARIED PROGRAM THAT CLOSELY RESEMBLES A MAINSTREAM HIGH SCHOOL EXPERIENCE WHILE PROVIDING INDIVIDUALIZED SUPPORT FOR DEVELOPING COMPENSATORY LEARNING STRATEGIES, ORGANIZATIONAL AND STUDY SKILLS, AND LAYING AN ACADEMIC FOUNDATION IN PREPARATION FOR COLLEGE. THE FOUR YEAR PROGRAM (GRADES 9-12) ENABLES STUDENTS TO OBTAIN EITHER A NEW YORK STATE REGENTS OR A LOCAL DIPLOMA BY COMPLETING COURSE, TESTING AND COMMUNITY SERVICE REQUIREMENTS.

ProgSrvcAccomActy2Grp.Desc: THE CHURCHILL CENTER OFFERS EDUCATIONAL PROGRAMS AND PROFESSIONAL DEVELOPMENT IN THE FIELD OF LEARNING DISABILITIES TO STUDENTS, PARENTS, TEACHERS AND RELATED SERVICE PROVIDERS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE CHURCHILL ENDOWMENT WAS ESTABLISHED TO PROVIDE FUNDS FOR STAFF SUPPORT. THE INVESTMENT OBJECTIVE OF CHURCHILL IS TO MAINTAIN THE PRINCIPAL ENDOWMENT FUNDS AT THE ORIGINAL AMOUNT DESIGNATED BY DONORS AND TO PROVIDE A PREDICTABLE STREAM OF FUNDING TO PROGRAMS SUPPORTED BY THE ENDOWMENT IN ADHERENCE WITH THE INVESTMENT POLICY STATEMENT ADOPTED BY THE BOARD, WITH OVERSIGHT PROVIDED THROUGH THE CHURCHILL INVESTMENT COMMITTEE.

churchill PUBLICIZED ITS RACIALLY NONDISCRIMINATORY POLICY THROUGH NEWSPAPER OR BROADCAST MEDIA DURING THE PERIOD OF SOLICITATION FOR STUDENTS, OR DURING THE REGISTRATION PERIOD IF IT HAS NO SOLICITATION PROGRAM, IN A WAY THAT MAKES THE POLICY KNOWN TO ALL PARTS OF THE GENERAL COMMUNITY IT SERVES.

CHURCHILL RECEIVES IDEA FUNDS WHICH ARE GOVERNMENTAL SUPPLEMENTAL FUNDS INTENDED TO ENHANCE AND IMPROVE THE EDUCATIONAL RESULTS OF STUDENTS WITH DISABILITIES. CHURCHILL ALSO RECEIVES FEDERAL FUNDING TO LIMIT EXCESSIVE TEACHER TURNOVER.

EMPLOYEES ARE ELIGIBLE TO RECEIVE MERIT BASED BONUSES FOR GENERAL PERFORMANCE. BONUSES ARE APPROVED BY THE BOARD FOR TIM MADIGAN AND MICHAEL DEVINE. THE HEAD OF SCHOOL APPROVES BONUSES FOR PRINCIPALS AND DIRECTORS.
The organization is reporting the numbers of contributors.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 11B
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE BOARD OF TRUSTEES WERE GIVEN A DRAFT OF FORM 990 TO REVIEW PRIOR TO FILING WITH THE IRS. ANY OPEN ISSUES AND QUESTIONS REGARDING INFORMATION IN THE FORM WILL BE RESOLVED BY THE CFO AND CORRECTIONS WILL BE MADE IF NECESSARY BEFORE FILING WITH THE IRS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 12C
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: A DISCLOSURE FORM IS SIGNED ANNUALLY BY EACH EMPLOYEE AND BOARD MEMBER, DISCLOSING ANY POSSIBLE CONFLICT OF INTEREST. IF AN ACTUAL OR POTENTIAL CONFLICT IS DISCOVERED THROUGH THE DISCLOSURE PROCESS, IT IS BROUGHT TO THE ATTENTION OF THE AUDIT COMMITTEE FOR FURTHER REVIEW AND ACTION IF NECESSARY.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 15
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE COMPENSATION FOR THE HEAD OF SCHOOL AND THE CFO IS DETERMINED BY USING COMPARATIVE DATA FROM A PEER GROUP OF SCHOOLS WITHIN THE NEW YORK METROPOLITAN AREA. THIS DATA IS REVIEWED BY THE EXECUTIVE COMMITTEE OF THE BOARD WITH A FINAL RECOMMENDATION OF COMPENSATION PRESENTED TO THE FULL BOARD FOR APPROVAL. THIS PROCESS WAS LAST CONDUCTED IN 2017 FOR THE 2018 SALARIES.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION C, LINE 19
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: FINANCIAL STATEMENTS ARE PROVIDED UPON REQUEST.
the process has not changed from the prior year.
